results.title: Backdrop for a play
results.brief_description: Shows the activities of a group of children who prepare thw backdrop, scenery and costumes and act out the fairy tale “Puss in Boots”, against a background of a deserted colonial mansion in the midlands of Tasmania.

results.title: One...two...sold!
results.brief_description: This film shows an example of one of the innovations being considered as an alternative to the traditional method of selling wool by auction at wool exhanges. The method proposed enables the woolbuyer to bid for any wool being offered for sale throughout Australia. Wool-buyers and woolbrokers are linked by an extensive network of computer outlets, which enables wool sales to be conducted without the face to face contact at a wool exchange.

results.title: Electronics: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Victor and Ellen Landweber and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Follows the development of electronic devices: a conductor, an electric light bulb, a diode vacuum tube, an amplifier, and the transistor. Concludes with a brief survey of electronic applications. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Perpetual motion
results.creator_credit: Harry Robin and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Uses several models of man’s attempts to create a perpetual motion machine to explore the laws of thermodynamics. Points out that energy must be continually added to any system to maintain orderly operation.
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Soviet Union: a student's life
results.brief_description: Looks at the structure of Soviet education, including early schooling, vocational schools, rigidity and difficulty of higher education. Explains the social and recreational life of students as well as the importance of school-state relationship.

results.title: What's your authority?
results.creator_credit: Gregory Heimer and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents two episodes involving children confronting the problems of authority. Examines the kinds of authority found in our society and the individual’s relation to authority. Produced by Greg Heimer in collaboration with Lawrence Kohlberg, Phd. Harvard.

results.title: [Plum pudding: a collection of 8 short animated films]
results.brief_description: This collection of short animated films directed by eight film students at the Newton Creative Arts Center shows a diverse range of issues that are laced to motivate and for showing students’ achievements. This creative media allows a mixture of students to experiment with film and animation.

results.title: Flat
results.brief_description: Carried out in a 2D reality, repetitive motions mirror the mechanical patterns in modern society. In this one-shot abstracted sequence, abscuring motion and direction, repeated gestures move beyond meaning and into compulsive necessity. Detail magnifies while reason fades.
